meanings.definition: Plunkier (comparative adjective): More plunky or solid in sound.
meanings.sent1: The drum in the band sounded plunkier than the guitar.
meanings.sent2: The new speaker was plunkier than the old one.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring became plunkier as it fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The plunkier beat of the music resonated through the room.
meanings.sent5: The plunkier notes of the piano added depth to the melody.

meanings.definition: Plunkier (adverb): In a more solid or resounding manner.
meanings.sent1: He hit the drum plunkier this time, creating a stronger beat.
meanings.sent2: The ball bounced plunkier on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent3: She sang plunkier than usual, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell plunkier on the roof, lulling him to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The hammer struck the nail plunkier, securing it in place.
